company_description: The Only Payment Solution You'll Ever Need | Wherever People Pay

title: Azure Data Engineer
description:
Ben je op zoek naar een uitdagende rol binnen een dynamisch bedrijf, waarbij je een robuuste data-infrastructuur op het Azure-platform ontwerpt, bouwt, implementeert en onderhoudt? Dan is Athora op zoek naar jou!

  

Als een van de grootste pensioenverzekeraars van Nederland speelt Athora Netherlands, met Zwitserleven als voornaamste merk, een belangrijke rol in het leven van onze klanten. Wij zorgen voor hun inkomen van morgen en maken daarom regelmatig keuzes die de wereld van morgen beïnvloeden.

  

Bij Athora werken we aan de beste versie van onszelf en aan een cultuur waarin vier gedragsprincipes centraal staan: Haal het beste uit jezelf (en haal het beste uit anderen), Sta voor wat je doet (en doe wat je zegt), Ga voor het beste (en maak beter wat goed is), Focus op resultaten (want resultaten geven richting). Binnen onze organisatie staan mensen, samenwerking en klantgerichtheid centraal. We werken samen aan en creëren een inclusieve werkomgeving waarin iedereen kan floreren.

 **Azure Data Engineer**



Als Azure Data Engineer speel je een sleutelrol bij het ontwerpen, bouwen, implementeren en onderhouden van een robuuste data-infrastructuur op het Azure-platform. Je verbindt, structureert en maakt data beschikbaar op een manier die onze organisatie een concurrentievoordeel geeft en ons helpt een echt data-gedreven organisatie te worden. Je optimaliseert datastromen voor betere prestaties en schaalbaarheid en werkt samen in multidisciplinaire teams om organisatorische behoeften om te zetten in technische oplossingen. Je hebt minimaal 4 jaar relevante werkervaring in een data-omgeving.

 **Wat breng je mee?**


* Kennis van Python (geavanceerd, object georiënteerd, design patterns)
* Kennis van Databricks (Pyspark, Spark SQL)
* Kennis van Azure Datawarehouse omgeving (DP-900, DP203)
* Bekend met de toepassing van gangbare Data Lake en Data Warehouse patronen en methodologieën
* Kennis van Azure DevOps (Git, YAML Pipelines)
* Kennis van de Microsoft BI stack:
	+ PowerBI
	+ Bekend met Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL)
	+ Bekend met SSIS/SSAS
* Ervaring met datamigraties
* Agile Safe
* Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.


**Competenties**


* Je bedenkt graag creatieve en innovatieve oplossingen en bent resultaatgericht
* Je waardeert het om samen te werken en te sparren met collega’s, maar kunt ook zelfstandig werken
* Je bent nieuwsgierig en wilt altijd blijven leren binnen en buiten je eigen vakgebied
* Je hebt een goed gevoel voor humor!


**Wij bieden**


* Een moderne en dynamische werkomgeving met fijne collega's
* Een goede balans tussen werken op kantoor en thuis
* Ruime mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling
* Flexibele werktijden met aandacht voor gezondheid en vitaliteit
* Een goed salaris en een 13e maand


**Geïnteresseerd?**



Solliciteer nu, kom met ons praten en sluit je aan bij het innovatieve en gepassioneerde team! Als je vragen hebt of meer informatie wilt, neem dan gerust contact op met Eveline via recruitment@athora.nl

 *Een Pre-Employment Screening is onderdeel van het Athora onboardingsproces.*

  



Athora is committed to diversity and being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more Diversiteit en inclusie (athora.nl)

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
Summary:  


Do you enjoy working on modern data architecture, designing solutions and making sure these solutions are implemented? If so, we are looking for you!  

Job Description:  

What will you do?
NIBC is seeking a skilled and motivated MLOps Engineer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in MLOps practices, experience with data science, and proficiency in Databricks and AzureML. As an MLOps Engineer, you will be responsible for the deployment, automation, and maintenance of machine learning models, ensuring their integration within the platform and operational efficiency.
If you are a proactive and detail-oriented MLOps Engineer with a passion for data science and experience in the risk domain or banking sector, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our team and help us drive the future of data-driven decision-making.
Key Responsibilities:* Deploy, automate, and maintain ML models using Databricks and AzureML.
* Collaborate with data scientists to ensure models are production-ready and meet performance standards.
* Develop and maintain GUI applications using tools like Streamlit to facilitate model interaction and visualization.
* Implement best practices in MLOps, ensuring models are scalable, reliable, and easy to monitor.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including risk domain experts and banking professionals, to understand and address their needs.
* Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders, ensuring transparency and collaboration throughout the project lifecycle.
* Maintain meticulous documentation of processes, configurations, and workflows.


Your team
We created the data & analytics team to enable our business to deliver high quality data products using a modern cloud data platform. The mission of this technology driven department is to ensure
that data can be sourced, ingested, integrated, and consumed through well designed, automated, and simple to use services and frameworks. The advanced analytics team is an agile team that works in close cooperation with the domain data teams (risk, retail bank, corporate bank, regulatory and finance). The core capabilities that need to be developed include Machine Learning and Monitoring. These capabilities should be metadata driven and tightly integrated with the Governance framework.
NIBC as an IT employer
NIBC IT consists out of several domains and together NIBC IT aims to be one of the driving forces behind the digital transformation of our bank, an ongoing process that will profoundly change the relationship with our clients and the way we do business. We are closely connected and have short lines of communication. If you have a good idea today, you may be elaborating it tomorrow. IT is forever changing and so is NIBC and in order for us to be able to keep on changing, we need sophisticated individuals to help us lead the bank into the future.
NIBC as organisation
Founded in 1945 to finance the visionary entrepreneurs who helped rebuilding the Netherlands after the second World War, NIBC was closely collaborating while professionally supporting companies and individuals in realizing their dreams and goals with a sustainable future in mind. As a multicultural midsize bank with a working environment that is best described as dynamic and ambitious, we share a forward-thinking, can-do attitude with our employees and clients which we call our THINK YES mentality. Our corporate values are Professional, Adaptive, Collaborative and Entrepreneurial. You will have a direct and meaningful impact on both the bank and its clients. By building our company on optimism and mutual trust, and with our THINK YES mentality, NIBC is an enterprising bank that enables ambitions.
What’s in it for you?
NIBC is an ambitious environment where together we strive to create a fantastic workplace where you feel safe and challenged to be the best version of yourself. This is in line Professional, Adaptive, Collaborative and Entrepreneurial, since you are in the lead of setting the PACE of your career at NIBC. In addition, you receive a competitive salary, plus:* Several ways to support your development personally and professionally, a.o.:
* Personal development budget, to spend at your own discretion
* Professional budget provided by your manager, to develop yourself in your work
* In-house training offering
* NIBC embraces the Hybrid way of Working. This means that we support working from home as well as encourage our colleagues to come to the office. NIBC's guideline is to spend at least half of the working time at the office;
* Travel expenses or NS Business Card 1st class;
* 32 holidays (which do not have to be registered);
* Excellent pension scheme (26% NIBC contribution);
* A voucher to improve your home office;
* The opportunity to take ownership and show initiative in your role. We are always open to new ideas, and encourage to use your voice;
* The nature of our Grow to Make a Difference program enables you to be in charge of your own development;
* Two staff associations: YoungNIBC and MyLeisure;
* Vitality program, annual company-wide sports & leisure days;
* Monthly internet allowance;
* Laptop and a company phone;
* Excellent facilities at the office (Coffeecorner, Restaurant, Exchange bar); · Last but not least, a fun workplace in which diversity and inclusion is valued (click here).


What do you bring?
Qualifications:* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 2-5 years of experience in MLOps, preferably within the risk domain or banking sector.
* Proficiency in Python for developing, deploying, and managing machine learning models.
* Strong understanding of data science modeling concepts and techniques.
* Experience working with Databricks and AzureML.
* Familiarity with GUI development using tools like Streamlit.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Attention to detail and a meticulous approach to process management.
* Experience in working in Agile/Scrum/DevOps teams or clear understanding of the methodology.
* Fluent English.


Advantageous to have:* Azure certification(s).
* Experience in risk management or financial services.
* Experience with MATLAB applications and operationalizing them.


Still intrigued?
Click the apply button now! To upload multiple documents, click the upload button again after uploading a document. An assessment may be part of the application procedure. For more information about the recruitment procedure or NIBC as employer you may contact our HR Servicedesk via AskHR@nibc.com

title: Data & Analytics Manager
description:
**Job title**: Data & Analytics Manager


**Salary**: Competitive + annual bonus


**Location**: Amsterdam


**Duration**: Permanent


**Working model:** Hybrid (3 days on-site/ 2 days remotely)


**Required languages** – English (fluent–mandatory), Dutch (desirable), Spanish (desirable), Italian (desirable)

  

At TCC Global, we help businesses develop and implement strategies to optimize customer experiences, enhance brand presence, and generate meaningful insights through data analysis. We work with our clients to create personalized marketing campaigns, loyalty programs, and customer engagement initiatives that deliver measurable results.

 **Primary Purpose & Scope:**

  

As a Data & Analytics Manager, you will leverage your expertise to extract valuable insights from complex datasets. This hands-on role involves executing data-driven projects, building models, and providing analytical support to enhance and measure the impact of loyalty marketing campaigns. You will work both internally and externally, collaborating with cross-functional teams to solve complex business challenges using data. Additionally, you will serve as a trusted advisor, supporting client pitches and project management to ensure high-quality data collection from clients and third-party providers.

 **Role and Responsibilities:**

  

* **Execute Data & Analytics Projects:** Collaborate with cross-functional teams to set project goals and deliverables. Manage end-to-end data analytics projects, including data processing, feature engineering, model building, and evaluation to address business challenges.
* **Data Exploration and Analysis:** Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and correlations. Use statistical techniques and data visualization tools to present insights effectively, with a focus on campaign performance analytics.
* **Model Development and Implementation:** Create predictive models and algorithms to support decision-making, optimize loyalty marketing campaigns, and enhance customer segmentation. Apply machine learning techniques and statistical modelling to develop robust models, including control group analysis and measuring campaign impact.
* **Data Quality and Quantity:** Support client meetings as a data expert to improve data collection processes, ensuring the right type and amount of data for developing analytical systems and models.
* **Collaboration with Project Management Team:** Provide in-depth analysis of campaign performance and offer consultancy on optimizing future campaigns. Use advanced data querying techniques to generate performance reports across all channels.
* **Collaboration with the Forecasting Team:** Assist in developing predictive models and forecasting algorithms to anticipate customer behaviour and market trends. Work closely with the Group Forecasting Team on insights and tools.
* **Tool and Platform Development:** Collaborate with the Business Intelligence Lead and Data Science Lead to contribute to the continuous improvement and development of analytical tools and platforms.

  


**Key Relationships:**

  

* **External:** Clients (marketing, IT, CRM & data teams), TCC vendors/partners.
* **Internal:** Commercial teams, Forecasting team, Project Management, Operations, Finance, Omnichannel teams.

  


**Core Values:**

  

* **Respect:** Treat others as they would like to be treated.
* **Truth:** Be honest and open at all times, learning from successes and mistakes.
* **Collaborate:** Enhance team performance through collective effort.
* **Care:** Show commitment to TCC, our future, our colleagues, our clients, and our community

 **What We Offer:**

  

* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Opportunity to work with leading global brands
* Dynamic and supportive work environment
* Career development and growth opportunities

 **Knowledge, Skills & Experience:**

  

* Experience with statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL) for data manipulation and insight extraction.
* Knowledge of various machine learning techniques (clustering, decision trees, neural networks) and their real-world applications.
* Understanding of advanced statistical techniques (regression, distributions, statistical tests) with practical experience.
* Bachelor’s degree in data science, mathematics, engineering, physics, or a related machine learning field.
* Experience with cloud platforms and services.
* Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
* Fluency in English is required; competency in Italian or Spanish is a plus

 **How to Apply:**

  

If you are passionate about data and analytics and have the skills we are looking for, we’d love to hear from you.

  

Please click ‘Apply’ below to submit your application.

  

We look forward to your application!
company_addresses: tcc is a global operator with 34 offices throughout the Americas, Europe, Asia Pacific and Australasia.
company_description: We believe it's more relevant than ever to encourage, recognise, and reward more loyal behaviour for the customers that matter.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
### **SENIOR DATA ENGINEER**


Our team in **Amsterdam** currently has an opening for a **Senior Data Engineer**


Brenntag is undergoing a group-wide transformation to deliver profitable organic growth and sustained group efficiencies. Data & Analytics is a key pillar which will allow us to ‘liberate’ our data and thus improve our decision-making at speed.  

  

We are looking for talented, self-starters with a passion for analytics to join our growing team. Our Data Engineering team is the key foundational capability to enable end to end analytics. As part of the Data Engineering team, your role has accountability for building the trusted high quality data products. Those data products will be used in various modern analytics products such as product recommendation engine, demand forecasting engine, pricing engine or management dashboards.  

  

You will collaborate with the Data Scientist, Data Visualization Designer/ Developers and ML Engineers, working within agile squads to ensure delivery of working and scalable analytics products.


### **YOUR ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Design, develop and maintain data ingestion, data processing and data producing pipelines according to the best practices
* Design and build reusable components, frameworks, and libraries at scale to support analytics products
* Build continuous integration and continuous deployment scripts to ensure high quality production
* Design and develop data quality observability and/or monitoring scripts, along with automated alerting
* Analyze and profile data for the purpose of developing analytics products
* Collaborate with a cross functional agile team of platform engineers, software engineers, data scientists, and product owners to build new products


### **YOUR PROFILE**


* A Masters degree in computer science, computer engineering, information technology or relevsant experience with other degree8+ years data engineering experience
* Strong skills in one or more programming languages related to data engineering (such as Python and Scala)
* Hands on experience with cloud environments such as (AWS alternatively Google Cloud/Azure)
* Hands on experience with Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Spark, Impala, HBase, Cassandra, Storm, Flume, Pig, or Hive
* Experience with event-driven data designs (Kafka)
* Experience with monitoring and alerting (Grafana, Logstash, Cloudwatch)
* Hands on experience in continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) tooling
* Experience with IaaC such as CDK, Terraform or similar concepts (Bicep, Ansible)
* Experience working on end-to-end solution designHas a strong problem solving and analytical mindset

### **OUR OFFER**


* Unique greenfield environment to drive change in a global business
* Open space in a vibrant start-up corporate incubator
* Lots of possibilities for professional development
* International team
* Friendly and supportive colleagues
* Competitive compensation package


### **INTERESTED?**


We look forward receiving your application.

  

  

  

Brenntag provides equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees of all backgrounds and identities to create a workplace where difference is valued because it forms a resilient and more innovative organization. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion or belief, parental and family status, or any other protected characteristic. We welcome applications from women, men and non-binary candidates of all ethnicities and socio-economic backgrounds.
company_description: Brenntag distributes chemicals and ingredients worldwide, offering tailored solutions in supply chain, marketing, and technical support across industries.

title: Customer Success Specialist
description:
**COMPANY DESCRIPTION**

Shoplogix is a fast-growing and highly innovative organization focused on delivering smart, could-based, software solutions that improve production performance for manufacturers worldwide. We have customers in 32 countries and direct representation in 11 countries. Shoplogix is an autonomous company under Constellation Software, the largest software group and the most successful technology stock in Canada over the last 10 years [TSX: CSU]. Shoplogix is in a unique position as it has the long-term and full backing of Constellation Software including access to their best practices and career opportunities. At the same time, Shoplogix has a highly entrepreneurial and dynamic culture given it operates as a fully autonomous company.

**PRODUCT DESCRIPTION**

Shoplogix is an advanced IIoT software platform that increases efficiency, boosts productivity and improves performance in manufacturing. We offer an innovative web-based solution that transforms the way we see, analyze and interpret data to drive machine and process efficiency on the plant-floor. Our cloud-based performance management solution delivers real-time visual tracking and analysis of production and automatically highlights the opportunity cost of downtime in a highly visual and intuitive reporting interface. Shoplogix integrates data visualization with powerful analytics to expose hidden losses, eliminate waste and accelerate continuous improvement and operational excellence.

**JOB SUMMARY**

We are looking to hire a Customer Success Specialist to provide customer support for our suite of hardware and software products. We are looking for the best people: self-motivated and driven professionals with very high ethical standards. You will be responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction by means of quick response to maintenance support requests, general help desk type requests and being very proactive with our quickly evolving product offering. You will be accountable for ensuring that existing customers continue to gain business value from our solution and maximize adoption. Best fits for this role tend to come from Engineering, Operations and Consulting backgrounds. If the candidate has a programming backgroundis Advantageous,

Your role will grow as you gain experience - in time, you could become involved with Customer Advocacy, Pre and Post-Sales Support, Customer and Partner Training and Field Services.

**What you'll be doing:** 

* **Help Desk:** Manage customer support cases on a day-to-day basis, including monitoring of the incoming queue, answering the support phone line, and escalate cases appropriately and in a timely manner.
* **Support:** Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues, including account setup and configuration. Determine the cause and solutions or workarounds to an issue. You will need to work with senior team members while learning how to effectively diagnose issues, but should become very self-sufficient, eventually providing ideas and feedback as to how we can enhance our product to avoid these issues in the future.
* **Adoption:** Present and discuss new features with the customer, perform the changes, then review and validate with the customer.
* **Communication** : Communicate with Customers about software features, updates, provide training and assist with implementation.
* **Process Improvement:** Help build our Knowledge Base and engage in continuous improvement by creating written materials which can be shared amongst the team as well as with our partner community and customers.
* **Advocacy:** Engage and support Continuous Improvement initiatives by assisting customers with improvement insights

**We are looking for candidates with:** 

* Technical Diploma or Certification in Engineering, Computer Science
* Excellent problem solving and communication skills.
* Ability to self-manage and be proactive when your tasks are complete.
* Knowledge of Electrical Wiring, PLC programming are advantages.
* Experience working in manufacturing environments and good understanding of manufacturing practices and Operational Excellence are valued
* Experience working directly with customers
* Good organization and time management skills are an absolute must.
* Customer Service experience and experience working with cross functional teams
* Ability to apply theoretical concepts to practical applications and installations.

**WHY SHOPLOGIX?** 

* Entrepreneurial and fast-growing software company, both through organic growth and acquisitions
* Access to best practices and growth opportunities through our owner Constellation Software
* Competitive compensation, flex hours and a comprehensive benefits package
* We take great pride in our first-class team and family like culture. “Open door” communication
* The premium and most progressive product on the market
* This is a full time and permanent position.

Work Remotely

* Yes

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Work Location: In person

title: CCO 3D Software House
description:
Lumion / Act-3D is a dynamic, fast growing, innovative company, dedicated to delivering cutting-edge software solutions for architects to streamline their operations and achieve their design objectives. Our mission is to provide exceptional value to our clients through our high  

quality, user-friendly rendering tool: Lumion. Our Headquarters are based in The Netherlands, near Leiden and Amsterdam, and we have a worldwide presence, especially in the USA.  

  

Due to our growth potential, we are expanding our executive team with a Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) position. The CCO will be a pivotal leader within Act-3D, reporting into the CEO and responsible for driving the company’s commercial strategy and overseeing all sales and marketing activities. The primary focus of the CCO will be on:
* leading the sales team to achieve and exceed revenue targets,


* expanding market presence,


* fostering customer relationships,


* managing strategic partnerships,


* develop a data driven approach to the marketing, sales and customer success function.



  

This role demands a strategic thinker with a proven track record in SaaS and partner sales, a deep understanding of our market dynamics (preferably AEC sector knowledge), and the ability to build, inspire, connect and lead a high-performing team.  

***Outline of the*** ***role:***
================================


Develop and implement a comprehensive commercial strategy to achieve company revenue goals and strategic objectives.  

Lead and mentor the Head of Sales and the Head of Marketing, setting clear performance objectives and ensuring strong cooperative relationships between the two departments. In the meanwhile working closely with the product development team in order to share market information and discuss strategy.  

  

**Sales****and****Sales****Operations****Leadership:**
* Develop a strategic view on our future Sales Department and recruit and build the Sales Department accordingly, together with the Head of Sales. Make sure both the Sales Operations Team and the Partner Management Team are developed towards a high performing team, in a structured, scalable way. Be the driver behind recruiting new high quality sales colleagues.
* Be the sparring partner for the Head of Sales in order to structure the sales processes. Set ambitious sales targets and develop plans to meet or exceed them. Monitor and analyze
* sales performance metrics, adjusting strategies as needed to optimize results for both direct channel and the international partners.
* Foster strong relationships with key customers and partners, ensuring a deep understanding of their needs and challenges. Implement customer retention strategies to maintain high levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty.
* Identify and target key markets and new partners, developing tailored approaches to maximize penetration and growth. Explore and implement innovative sales techniques and tools to enhance efficiency and effectiveness:
	+ selecting the right partners in line with strategic plan
	+ review existing partners based on strategy and performance
	+ focus partnership on upselling / cross-selling and retention.

**Marketing** **Management:**
* Work closely with the marketing manager to create effective campaigns that drive brand awareness and generate leads.
* Guide the marketing Manager and team to develop and execute integrated sales and marketing initiatives.
* Identify new market opportunities and develop strategies to enter and grow in these markets both from a marketing and sales perspective.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to stay ahead of industry trends and adjust strategies accordingly.
* Act as the voice of the customer within the company, advocating for their needs and driving product improvements.


  

**Collaboration****and****Cross-functional****Leadership:**
* Interact on a regular basis with the product development team to ensure the sales and marketing strategy aligns with product offerings and capabilities, whilst sharing market information.
* Participate in strategic planning and decision-making processes as a key member of the executive team.

**What you must bring to the** **table:**
=========================================


* Master’s degree in Business, Economics or a related field, a degree in Marketing would be an advantage.
* 10+ years of experience in an international, B2B sales management role, at least 5 years of experience within a SaaS or technology company, a proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
* Strategic thinker with the ability to develop and execute effective sales strategies.
* Clear understanding of SaaS business models, market dynamics, and customer needs.
* Interest in the AEC sector, preferably sales experience selling AEC software or alike.
* Proven track record of partner sales experience and a clear strategic vision on how to manage the Partner Channel.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a commercial team.
* Exceptional communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, able to thrive in a cross cultural environment.
* Proficiency in CRM software and sales analytics tools.
* Fluency in English.


  

**Personal** **Attributes:**
* Results-oriented with a strong drive for success.
* Adaptable and able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Creative, innovative and open to new ideas and approaches.
* Collaborative team player and a well developed people manager, who is self-critical with a positive outlook and proactive attitude.
* Willingness to travel to the office minimum 3 days a week. This is not a remote position.

**Why Join** **us?**
====================


At Lumion / Act-3D we believe in fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration. As the CCO, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our growth trajectory and shape the future of our company. This is an opportunity in a fast-growing company, to work with a beautiful product, and an enthusiastic, dedicated team.  

  

**Lumion** **offers:**
* a competitive compensation package (fixed and variable)
* professional development opportunities
* a supportive work environment
* 30 vacation days per year
* 20 workation days per year
* a shared, free lunch with all colleagues 4 days a week
* free 24/7 access to our office gym
**About our product:** **Lumion**
=================================


  

Lumion is industry-leading visualization software made for architects. Lumion is designed to make rendering seamless and enjoyable, making it possible to import a 3D model and quickly create stunning photorealistic images, videos, and panoramas with ease. Lumion lets architects and designers remain in their creative flow by syncing directly with their CAD software, giving them freedom to model and render in real time. It provides a wealth of tools, effects, and creative design features that help an architect give shape to their vision, and visualize the world they aspire to.  

Lumion is used by hundreds of thousands of enthusiastic users in over 180 countries and has been adopted by three-quarters of the world's top 100 architecture firms. For more information: www.lumion.com.  

**About our company: Act-3D /** **Lumion**
==========================================


  

We're a small and passionate team of developers, architects, designers, and visualization artists. As a company on the rise, our dynamic team consists of 50+ dedicated individuals at our headquarters in Sassenheim, The Netherlands, with an additional 30+ talented professionals working remotely across the globe.  

  

At Act-3D, adaptability is at our core, and we thrive on constant evolution. Our enthusiasm goes beyond just the product – it's rooted in our commitment to our customers. Focused and driven, we channel our energy into the substance of our work, aiming to uplift every member of our team.  

  

While we approach our work with a sense of humor and humility, we maintain high expectations. A career at Act-3D is an invitation to challenge yourself continually, fostering an environment where personal growth and improvement are not just encouraged but celebrated. Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to push boundaries and set new standards in the industry.

title: Data scientist
description:
* Erp (NL)
* fulltime site.employment\_type\_full\_time

Are you a data enthusiast who loves to extract insights from complex datasets? Would you like to work in a company that is professional and robust enough to have a wealth of data at your disposal, yet small enough to ensure that your contribution has a significant impact? We offer the opportunity to immerse yourself in a variety of projects and disciplines, guaranteeing an experience that is incredibly diverse and constantly evolving.


As a data scientist at Van den Bosch, you will be part of a multidisciplinary team of experts who are responsible for delivering innovative solutions to our internal and external clients. You will work on challenging projects that involve data mining, machine learning, statistical modeling, and visualization. You will use your skills and creativity to find insights and patterns that can help us to optimize our service in the supply chain.



You also can learn from your colleagues, share your knowledge, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our methods and tools. You will enjoy a flexible and supportive work environment that values your professional development and well-being. You will have fun working with a diverse and talented team that shares your passion for data and innovation.


##### **Your profile**


* A bachelor's or master's degree or PhD in computer science, mathematics, statistics, engineering, or a related field.
* Relevant experience in data science, data analysis, and visualization.
* Proficiency in Python, R and SQL.
* A strong interest in applying machine learning, statistical modeling, and data mining techniques to real-world problems.
* Communication and presentation skills, and the ability to explain complex concepts to different audiences.


##### **Our offer**


* A unique opportunity to work with extensive datasets in a professional, yet personal environment.
* The freedom to focus on exciting and impactful projects and disciplines, ensuring a dynamic and varied work experience.
* A culture where your contribution is visible and where you have a direct impact on the company's results.
* A fun and friendly team of data enthusiasts, who are always ready to help and learn from each other.
* A competitive salary and benefits package, pension, and the option to work from home.


**This is Van den Bosch**
-------------------------


* Dynamic, young and international teams
* Plenty of room for development and growth
* Leading the way together through innovation and digitisation
* Work and private life always in balance
* Named ‘World-class workplace’ in 2023


About us


Are you the data scientist we are looking for?


Get in touch with our hr business partner Jim Hillekens and share your motivation and cv. Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.
company_description: We want to move forward. With a relentless focus on learning and development, we ensure together that Van den Bosch achieves its mission: to set change in motion as the Supply Changer in Bulk.

title: PhD position Human versus Artificial: A Radical Embodied Turing Test
description:
The rise of AI is accompanied by an equal rise of the worry about how to distinguish human-made from AI-generated output. In this project we investigate both the structural differences between human-made and AI-generated output as well as people’s differential behavioural and physiological responses to them. Concretely, we will study: (1) the spatiotemporal patterns of human-made and AI-generated images/artworks, texts and conversations; (2) people’s behavioural and physiological responses when viewing and reading human-made and AI-generated images/artworks and texts, respectively; (3) the extent and effects of synchronisation when people engage in conversations with chatbots. The goal is to develop a Radical Embodied Turing Test (RETT), on which next-generation AI-detection tools can be based and which can also help to enhance user experience with AI.



The tasks of the PhD candidate are


* Conduct research that results in a dissertation and is in line with the objectives and requirements of the project.
* Organize and execute the data collection for the different studies.
* Publish the results of the research in international scientific journals.
* Present the research findings to fellow scientists and developers in the larger project and collaborate with them.
* Provide a limited number of educational activities at the Psychology department, such as small-scale tutorials and guest lectures, in collaboration with the supervisors.


Organisation  

The University of Groningen is a research university with a global outlook, deeply rooted in Groningen, City of Talent. Quality has had top priority for four hundred years and with success: the University is currently in or around the top 100 on several influential ranking lists.



The PhD project is a collaboration between the Heymans Institute for Psychological Research of the Faculty of Behavioural and Social Sciences and the SEARCH research group at the Faculty of Science and Engineering. The candidate will be a member of the graduate school of BSS.



The Faculty of Behavioural and Social Sciences excels in teaching and research in the fields of human behaviour, thinking, learning and how people live together. We work on societal issues and problems that people experience in daily life. Central to this is individual and societal resilience and how to increase this. To this end, we focus on the topics of migration, the environment and climate, health, upbringing and education, the protection of vulnerable minorities and sustainable partnerships. The Faculty of Behavioural and Social Sciences employs over 650 staff members. For more information about the Faculty please check the link https://www.rug.nl/gmw/.



The Software Engineering and Architecture (SEARCH) research group at the University of Groningen focuses on improving software and team health. Their vision emphasizes maintainable, high-performing software with low technical debt and productive, diverse teams. The group conducts research on topics including software architecture, technical debt, human factors and sustainable software. SEARCH is part of the Faculty of Science and Engineering (FSE) at the University of Groningen: FSE conducts cutting-edge research in various scientific disciplines, collaborating with industry and societal partners to address fundamental and applied scientific questions.



**Qualifications**
------------------



For this position you are expected to have the following qualifications


* Have a (research) master's degree in Experimental Psychology, Movement Science, or Computer Science (or a related discipline).
* Have a good academic track record.
* Be enthusiastic about writing international publications and a dissertation.
* Have good academic English writing skills.
* Have good social and communication skills and are willing to work with other team members.
* Be enthusiastic about translating scientific insights into practical guidelines and advice.
* Have good organisational skills and the motivation to organise and realise data collection.
* Have demonstrable competencies such as conceptual capacity, presenting, planning, organising and monitoring.


Additionally, having some of the following additional qualifications and technical skills counts as an advantage


* Have an interest in complex dynamical systems theory and nonlinear time-series analysis, and/or a willingness to learn about this.
* Experience with statistical analysis software and programming languages relevant to the project (e.g., SPSS, R, Matlab, or Python).
* Familiarity with machine learning techniques and AI-related research.
* Experience in conducting behavioural experiments and physiological measurements.
* Understanding of ethical considerations in AI and psychological research.
* Experience with data visualization tools and techniques.
* Familiarity with the latest developments in AI detection tools and technologies.
* Experience with data collection methodologies and software.
**Organisation**
----------------


**Conditions of employment**
----------------------------



We offer you in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities


* A salary of € 2,770 gross per month in the first year of the appointment, rising to € 3,539 gross per month in the fourth year for a full-time position.
* A holiday allowance of 8% gross annual income an 8.3% end-of-the-year allowance.
* Attractive secondary terms of employment.
* The position is classified in accordance with the University Job Classification (UFO) system; the UFO profile is PhD candidate.
* A temporary employment of 1.0 FTE for a period of four years. You will first be employed for a period of one year. After a positive result and development interview, the contract will be extended for the remaining period of three years.


Intended starting date: December 1st, 2024



**Application**
---------------



You can apply by submitting a letter of application and curriculum vitae before October 1st, 2024. Only submissions via the application form will be considered.



The selection interviews will take place in the second/third week of October 2024.



The University of Groningen strives to be a university in which students and staff are respected and feel at home, regardless of differences in background, experiences, perspectives, and identities. We believe that working on our core values of inclusion and equality are a joint responsibility and we are constructively working on creating a socially safe environment. Diversity among students and staff members enriches academic debate and contributes to the quality of our teaching and research. We therefore invite applicants from underrepresented groups in particular to apply. For more information, see also our diversity policy webpage: https://www.rug.nl/about-ug/policy-and-strategy/diversity-and-inclusion/
  

Our selection procedure follows the guidelines of the Recruitment code (NVP): https://www.nvp-hrnetwerk.nl/nl/sollicitatiecode and European Commission's European Code of Conduct for recruitment of researchers: https://euraxess.ec.europa.eu/jobs/charter/code



We provide career services for partners of new faculty members moving to Groningen.



Unsolicited marketing is not appreciated.



**Information**
---------------



For information you can contact:


* Dr. R.F.A. (Ralf) Cox, (+31)-(0)503636547, r.f.a.cox rug.nl

Please do not use the e-mail address(es) above for applications.



**Additional information**
--------------------------


* Heymans Institute
* Bernoulli Institute
* Capiluppi
* Cox

title: data specialist
description:
### **Description**

  

As a ‘data specialist - hotel products’ your mission is to transform mountains of data into golden insights that drive amazing experiences for our guests and ambassadors. You'll be the bridge between raw numbers and smart decisions, ensuring our products shine and amaze our guests and hotel ambassadors alike. Picture yourself turning insight requests from product owners into valid research questions and craft clever hypotheses and setting up experiments to test them. You'll be the detective who translates these findings into actionable insights, proposing the best metrics and KPIs to track our success. Keeping our data pristine will be your mantra, and you'll use your storytelling magic to create compelling data visualizations that captivate key stakeholders to ensure issues are being resolved. Working hand-in-hand with data engineers from the Business Intelligence team, you'll craft essential reports and dashboards to monitor product performance.  

In this role, you will be our data hero who helps create seamless, joyful experiences for our guests and hotel personnel (ambassadors).### **Key Responsibilities**

  

* Actively provide input for optimizations on data solutions within the hotel domain
* Working closely to the relevant business unit/s and develop a strong network across several layers within the organization
* Coaching and upskilling business analysts on data analytic skills
* Translating insight requests from product owners into valid research questions and hypotheses
* Defining and setting up quantitative or qualitative research methods to prove (or disprove) your hypothesis
* Locating the root cause issues in the customer journey and translating these outcomes into actionable insights
* Defining proposals for metrics and KPIs linked to product performance
* Creating & safeguarding golden standards for data quality within the products
* Applying different data visualization and storytelling techniques in order to convey the message and onboard key stakeholders
* Writing measurement plans to make new data available
* Leading a project with the collaboration of the Business Intelligence Team to set up the necessary reports and dashboards for monitoring the product
* Monitoring product performance and create recommendations where action is needed

  

### **Qualifications / skills**

  

* You have a curious mind and love to deep dive a lake of data and locate hidden gems and surprise the product team with actionable insights
* You can easily determine significance or causality and prioritize problems to be resolved accordingly
* You enjoy setting up experiments to improve our processes and resolve customer friction
* You enjoy working in a fast paced environment with varied activities and responsibilities
* You have the skills to tell clear and convincing stories through data visualizations
* You won’t rest until you solved the problem and see the intended results
* Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience
* Relevant work experience in data or business analysis or a related field
* Experience with SQL, Google Analytics or PowerBI is an advantage
* Excellent English communication skills
* Experience in agile working environments

  

### **What's in it for you?**

  

* citizenM experience nights for you (and friends and family)
* Personal and professional development opportunities and programs
* Latest tech devices and all the tools you need to be successful in your role
* Commuting travel costs covered (by car or public transport)
* Pension and cycle-to-work scheme
* Subsidized fresh daily lunches at our support office
* Flexible public holidays
* Employee assistance program
* Varied team days and social events (from food trucks and quizzes at the office to parties on boats)
* Spacious office in a historic building surrounded by gardens

*Please note that we are only able to consider applicants with the right to work in the Netherlands. We won't be able to sponsor Visas for this role.*### **About citizenM**


citizenM is an affordable luxury hotel chain for mobile citizens of the world. With a style that will knock your socks off, we offer citizens a real home from home, plus the world’s fluffiest pillows. Our typical guest is a frequent traveler who is quality and design-driven, and value-conscious. We currently have hotels in the Netherlands, France, UK, Switzerland, Denmark, USA, and Asia, with more to come soon. We are proud to put hospitality back into the hospitality industry and have received numerous awards for our groundbreaking approach. We like to do things differently. This means our hotels are not traditional… and neither are our support offices. We're open-minded, with kind hearts and global minds.  

  

We actively seek applications from qualified individuals and groups who are under-represented in the workplace, whether in relation to religion, ethnicity, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability. We’re also happy to make accommodations in the interview process and beyond to best suit the needs and strengths of disabled people and neurodivergent individuals. If you require accommodations, please add a note in your application and we will work together to find the best solution possible.
company_description: citizenM is a new breed of hotels welcoming lovers of affordable luxury 18 cities, 30 hotels and more on the way

title: Senior Specialist – ICT Solutions Architect, Architecture Team, ICT Strategy & Execution Coordination Unit (AD8)
description:
**ORGANISATIONAL CONTEXT**
--------------------------

*This selection procedure is intended to fill one (1) currently available post.*  

  

*Europol retains the right to make use of the reserve list to select candidates for similar posts within the organisation, should business needs require so.*  

  

**Organisational setting:**  

The post of Senior Specialist – ICT Solutions Architect, is located in the Architecture Team, ICT Strategy & Execution Coordination Unit, ICT Department, Capabilities Directorate.  

  

The ICT Department has the responsibility for devising, delivering and operating critical technology capabilities and solutions supporting the core mission and support processes of Europol. Over 150 internal staff members and a significant number of domain-specific consultants are responsible for devising, developing, delivering and operating information management and communication technology capabilities that ensure enhanced criminal information analysis and exchange among Europol, Member States and third parties.  

  

**Purpose of the post:**  

The selected candidate will work in a team of enterprise and solution architects, each one predominantly focused in the specific architecture domain area for which they are most competent, but all closely cooperating as a team, coordinated by a Senior Specialist.  

  

The incumbent will cooperate closely with software and infrastructure engineering and ICT Operations teams, providing hands-on architecture guidance and contributing to solution engineering as well as product management.  

  

S/he will translate business requirements into solutions architecture and designs, producing baseline and target solution architecture documentation, and ensure their respective roadmaps are aligned with the business strategy on one side and with the overall ICT evolution on the other side.  

  

**Reporting lines:**  

The incumbent will report to the Head of the Architecture Team/Head of Unit - ICT Strategy & Execution Coordination.

**FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES**
------------------------


The incumbent carries out the following main functions and duties:  

* Produce, maintain, update, disseminate and expand the set of architecture standards, guidelines and reference architectures for the implementation and support of decentralised, cloud and datacentre-based solutions, focusing on the application and integration architecture aspects, either for custom built or COTS deployments;
* Identify and specify ICT architecture components required to enable the delivery of decentralised, cloud as well as datacentre-based solutions, providing guidance and review for their implementation and configuration, with as much detail as needed from time to time;
* Liaise with key stakeholders to support planning and execution of ICT changes and development initiatives;
* Assume quality assurance roles in ICT development projects;
* As needed, act as Technical Product Manager of selected systems and platforms, taking responsibility for the ICT product throughout its life cycle;
* Monitor and/or participate to selected EU, law enforcement, or other relevant fora, and sponsor internal adoption of interfaces and standards supporting the delivery and support of decentralised solutions;
* Devise capability and solution architecture blueprints (including roadmaps) in support of strategic as well as change initiative objectives;
* Upon request, participate in solution engineering and system administration activities, in cooperation with software and infrastructure engineering and ICT operations teams;
* Drive the evaluation and selection of the technical products that are required to implement decentralised, cloud and datacentre-based ICT solutions;
* Assesses business cases, project proposals, and project deliverables, to determine feasibility, impact on, and compliance with, the overall ICT architecture and landscape;
* Perform any other duties in the area of competence as assigned by the line management.
 **REQUIREMENTS - ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA**


**a. Candidates must**  

* Be a national of one of the Member States of the European Union and enjoy full rights as a citizen;
* Have fulfilled any obligations imposed by the applicable laws on military service;
* Produce appropriate character references as to his or her suitability for the performance of the duties;
* Be physically fit to perform the duties pertaining to the post as further specified in Article 13 of the Conditions of Employment of Other Servants of the European Union (CEOS);
* Produce evidence of a thorough knowledge of one of the languages of the Union and a satisfactory knowledge of another language of the Union to the extent necessary for the performance of the duties.

  

(CONTINUES IN SECTION BELOW)**REQUIREMENTS - ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA**
-----------------------------------------------------

**b. Candidates must have**  

* A level of education which corresponds to completed university studies attested by a diploma when the normal period of university education is four years or more;

**OR**  

* A level of education which corresponds to completed university studies attested by a diploma and appropriate professional experience of at least one year when the normal period of university education is at least three years;

**OR**  

* Professional training of an equivalent level in a relevant area and after having completed the training, at least the number of years of relevant professional experience as indicated below:

  

**Duration of professional training Additional professional experience required for equivalency**  

More than 6 months and up to 1 year 4 years  

More than 1 year and up to 2 years 3 years  

More than 2 years and up to 3 years 2 years  

More than 3 years 1 year
* **In addition** to the above **at least 9 years** of professional work experience gained after the award of the diploma.

  

**REQUIREMENTS - SELECTION CRITERIA**  

  

**a. Professional experience:**  

**Essential:**  

* Experience in architecture definition, specification, change management and providing architecture supervision and support to ICT delivery projects;
* Experience in designing applications for large scale deployments across a number of functional domains (i.e. web interfaces for data analysis and exploration, messaging and collaboration systems, reporting solutions, etc.) based on a combination of custom-built (mainly JEE, .Net and Python) or Commercial of the Shelf (COTS) products;
* Experience with devising designs to integrate custom-built and COTS based systems;
* Experience in incorporating the requirements of ICT operability and security into application and integration designs;
* Experience with complex agile software development;
* Experience in the following domain areas:


o Data integration, acquisition, processing and reporting/visualization architectures and standards;  

o Web services architecture and standards;  

o Microservices and event-driven architectures and standards (ex. containerized Kubernetes deployments and transactional integrity for microservices applications);  

o Search system architectures and standards (ex. Elasticsearch, Opensearch and similar);
  

o Cloud application and services design/integration, including hybrid cloud/on-premises deployments;  

o Privacy and Data Protection by design solutions.  

  

**Desirable:**
  

* Experience with the Archimate modelling standard;
* Experience with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence concepts, methods and tools/frameworks/processes;
* Experience in a complex public sector or international environment;
* Experience in designing ICT solutions specific to the Law Enforcement and Justice areas.


**b. Professional knowledge:**  

**Essential:**  

* Sound knowledge of the concepts, methods, techniques, and representative products in the following domain areas:


o Web scale architectures and software frameworks / libraries;  

o Microservices patterns and anti-patterns (i.e. Service Mesh, Distributed Tracing, Circuit Breaker, etc.)  

o Event-driven and Complex event processing architecture patterns and anti-patterns;  

o Cloud application components and services architectures, design patterns/anti-patterns;  

o Privacy by design techniques;  

o Enterprise search architecture patterns and anti-patterns, tackling cross system/network search needs including the document model definition and evolution;
o Information architectures and standards, meta-data management, master data management, data modelling and design, data quality management;  

o Data integration solutions, ETL and streaming data solutions, including data modelling and designs for that purpose across management.  

* Knowledge of Architecture Modelling techniques: conceptualisation, modelling, and visualisation of architecture models and designs.

  

**Desirable:**  

* Knowledge in the following domains:

o Virtualisation technologies and products;  

o Information security;  

* Knowledge of security design principles, including expertise in Threat Modelling techniques (i.e. STRIDE) and proficiency in modern authorization/authentication techniques such as Attribute-Based Access Control or Access Token pattern comprising relevant standards (i.e. OAuth2 and OIDC).

  

**c. General competencies**  

**Essential:**  

  

**Communicating:**  

* Excellent communication skills in English, both orally and in writing.
* Excellent presentation skills.
* Ability to draft clear and concise documents on complex matters for various audiences.

  

**Analysing & problem solving:**  

* Excellent analytical and problem solving skills including the ability to anticipate potential problems, determine and implement solutions.
* Competent user of Microsoft Office applications (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook) and the internet.

  

**Delivering quality and results:**  

* High degree of commitment and flexibility.
* High level of customer and service-orientation.
* Ability to display initiative and a drive for improvement.

  

**Prioritising and organising:**  

* Excellent organizational skills including the ability to plan work load, establish clear priorities and exercise initiative.
* Ability to manage projects and familiarity with project management terminology and methodology.

  

**Resilience:**  

* Excellent ability to work well both independently and in a team.
* Ability to remain effective under a heavy workload and demonstrate resistance to stress.

**Living diversity:**  

* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relations with co-workers in an international and multi-disciplinary work environment.

  

**Advising:**  

* Strong ability to synthesise various data into a coherent and relevant whole, transforming it into a valuable and correct conclusion.
* Building constructive relationships with clients, adequately identifying and managing their needs and expectations, and giving well-grounded advice.

  

**d. Additional conditions:**  

**Fulfil the condition stipulated in Article 5 of the Decision of the Executive Director on the Duration of contracts of employment for Temporary Agents, on the start date of the possible contract of employment which may be offered.****SELECTION PROCEDURE**
-----------------------

**All applications for Temporary Agent posts must be submitted through the online recruitment system accessible via** **Europol’s website****. For further information, please consult the** **Europol Recruitment Guidelines****.**  

  

The Authority Authorised to Conclude Contracts of Employment (AACC) sets up a Selection Committee, composed of at least three members, consisting of one chair and at least one member from the administration and one member designated by the Staff Committee.  

  

The selection criteria, set out in this Vacancy Notice, will be assessed by the Selection Committee throughout the different stages of the selection procedure. Before the start of the selection procedure, the Selection Committee will decide which selection criteria will be used at each stage of the selection procedure. Certain selection criteria will be assessed only for shortlisted candidates during a written test and/or a competency-based interview.  

  

The Selection Committee will assess the applications received in order to make an initial selection of those candidates meeting all eligibility criteria and matching best the selection criteria (suitability).  

  

The minimum pass-mark for being shortlisted, i.e. invited to participate in a post-related selection procedure, consisting of a written test and a competency-based interview, is established as 60% of the total maximum score.  

  

The Selection Committee will shortlist the **8** highest scoring candidates. All candidates having a score equal to the **8th** highest scoring candidate will be invited to take part in the selection procedure. At shortlisting stage, the Selection Committee will establish the pass-mark for the selection procedure.  

  

It is intended for the selection procedure to be conducted remotely. Should the Selection Committee consider it necessary to conduct the selection procedure on-site at Europol in the interest of the proceedings, and subject to budget availability, the candidates invited to participate in the selection procedure will be informed accordingly.  

  

After the selection procedure has taken place, the Selection Committee will establish a list of successful candidates, i.e. those scoring above the pre-defined pass-mark, which is shared with the AACC.  

  

The Selection Committee makes a proposal to the AACC on the candidate(s) to appoint. Following that proposal, the AACC makes a decision of appointment.  

  

Candidates who participated in the interview will be informed of the outcome, i.e. whether they have been successful or not. In view of the list of successful candidates established by the Selection Committee, the AACC retains the discretion to constitute a Reserve List. A Reserve List is valid for 24 months.  

  

The Selection Committee’s work and deliberations are confidential. It is forbidden for candidates to make direct or indirect contact with the members of the Selection Committee or for anyone to do so on their behalf.  

  

All enquiries related to a selection procedure should be addressed to the Europol HR Operational Support Team at the following email address: C2-121@europol.europa.eu. Detailed information on the selection procedure- including enquiries, measures of redress and their applicable deadlines is available in the Europol Recruitment Guidelines, which can be found on www.europol.europa.eu.

**COMPENSATION, TERMS AND CONDITIONS**
--------------------------------------

**Scale: AD8**  

The basic monthly salary is EUR **8,216.45** (step 1) or EUR **8,561.72** (step 2).  

  

The step in grade is determined on the basis of professional experience gained after the education required for the position and in line with applicable implementing rules.  

  

Staff pay EU tax at source but salaries are exempt from national taxes. Compulsory deductions are made for medical insurance, pension and unemployment insurance.  

  

Subject to the applicable conditions being met, as defined in the EU Staff Regulations (EUSR)/CEOS and further specified in the case law of the Court of Justice of the European Union, allowances such as expatriation allowance (16% of basic gross salary) or foreign residence allowance (4% of basic gross salary), household allowance, dependent child and/or education allowance may be granted.  

  

Staff enjoy worldwide insurance coverage by the Joint Sickness Insurance Scheme (JSIS) and are insured against sickness, the risk of occupational disease and accident (conditions and ceilings apply).  

  

Europol offers flexible working arrangements, a comprehensive provision for annual leave as well as parental leave supporting a healthy work-life balance.  

  

**Indicative net salary sample calculation AD8/1:**  

a) Staff member (single) in receipt of expatriation allowance (16%): EUR **8,311.15**  

b) Staff member with two dependent children in their custody in receipt of expatriation allowance (16%): EUR **10,504.24**  

  

The above information is indicative and for information purposes only. It is merely meant to give an indication of your possible net salary in light of the currently applicable amounts of the related allowances and the level of taxation. It has no legal value and no rights can be derived from it.  

  

The information is based on figures applicable as of January 2024.  

  

**Contract of employment**  

The successful candidate will be engaged in the type of post **Administrator** and function group **AD**, grade **8** pursuant to Article 2(f) CEOS and Annex I to the EUSR.  

  

The initial contract will be concluded for a period of 4 years (full-time – 40 hours a week). The contract may be renewed, in principle, for a period of 2 years. Any further renewal shall be for an indefinite duration.  

  

**If the successful candidate is already a member of temporary staff 2(f) in the relevant function group, he/she may be offered the opportunity of contract continuity, should the relevant conditions be fulfilled.**  

  

**Conditions of engagement**  

Before the employment contract is concluded by Europol, the successful candidate will have to:  

* declare any conflict of interest;
* undergo a pre-employment medical examination to confirm that he/she is physically fit to perform the duties pertaining to the post or, alternatively, receive the confirmation from Europol that he/she fulfils the conditions laid down in the Decision of the Deputy Executive Director of the Capabilities Directorate on the pre-employment medical examination available on www.europol.europa.eu;

  

The place of employment will be The Hague, The Netherlands.  

  

For further information on terms and conditions, please consult the EUSR/CEOS available on Europol’s website.**Probation period**  

Engagement for this post is subject to the successful completion of a probationary period of 9 months.  

  

If the successful candidate chooses contract continuity, and has already successfuly completed the probationary period provided for in Article 14 of the CEOS, in the relevant function group, he/she will not serve the probationary period.  

  

Europol reserves the right to terminate the contract of employment during or at the end of the probation period in accordance with Article 14 CEOS.  

  

**Security screening and certificate of good conduct**  

Candidates who have been recruited to a post at Europol are required to furnish a valid certificate of good conduct before the start of their employment. The certificate of good conduct must be provided to Europol prior to the signature of the employment contract. The certificate of good conduct must be issued by the relevant authorities of the country of nationality of the candidate and must not be older than three months at the time of submission to Europol. Europol reserves the right not to proceed with the signature of the contract based on the content of the certificate or if the candidate fails to provide the certificate to Europol.  

  

The certificate of good conduct does not substitute a valid security clearance required for all Europol staff at the level indicated in the vacancy notice. Failure to obtain the requisite security clearance before the expiration of the probationary period may be cause for termination of the employment contract.  

  

Candidates who currently hold a valid security clearance at the level indicated in the vacancy notice or above do not need to obtain a certificate of good conduct or a new security clearance and must provide a copy of the current security clearance certificate to Europol prior to the signature of the employment contract. Europol shall verify and confirm the continued validity of the security clearance. In case Europol determines that the security clearance is not valid, the candidate will be required to provide a valid certificate of good conduct prior to the signature of the employment contract. Europol may at any time terminate the employment contract if the result of the security screening is not positive and the necessary clearance level is not granted or extended.  

  

The requested level of security clearance for this post is: **CONFIDENTIAL UE/EU CONFIDENTIAL**.

**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**
--------------------------

**Equal opportunity**  

Europol is an equal opportunity employer. Europol accepts applications without distinction on grounds of gender, sexual orientation, national, ethnic or social origin, religion or beliefs, family situation, age, disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications, experience and skills.  

  

Europol lives diversity and provides an inclusive work environment to all. Europol strives to recruit, develop and retain a diverse and talented workforce through application of equal opportunity and impartiality.  

  

**Privacy Notice**  

Regulation (EU) 2018/1725 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 October 2018 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data by the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 and Decision No 1247/2002/EC, applies to the processing of personal data carried out in the process of selection and recruitment of staff at Europol, following the application of this Regulation to all administrative personal data held by Europol in accordance with Article 46 of the Europol Regulation.  

  

For additional information, please consult the applicable privacy notice available on Europol’s website, also inserted in the EUROPOL RECRUITMENT GUIDELINES.


**Statutory obligations upon leaving the service**  

Pursuant to Article 16 of the EUSR, EU officials and, by analogy, temporary agents continue to be bound by the duty to behave with integrity and discretion as regards the acceptance of certain appointments or benefits after leaving the service. Those staff members intending to engage in an occupational activity within two years of leaving the service shall inform their institution, so that it may take an appropriate decision in that respect. In cases where the intended activity is related to the work carried out by the staff member during the last three years of service and could lead to a conflict with the legitimate interests of the institution, the decision to be taken may include forbidding the staff member from undertaking it or giving its approval subject to any conditions it thinks fit.  

  

**Main dates**  

Publication date: **25 July 2024**  

Deadline for application: **06 September 2024, 23:59 Amsterdam Time Zone**  

Selection procedure: **October/November 2024**  

  

**Application process and selection procedure**  

For further details on the application process and the selection procedure, please consult our FAQs or refer to the EUROPOL RECRUITMENT GUIDELINES available on Europol’s website.  

  

**Contact details**  

In case of further questions please call +31 (0) 70 353 1154.

description:

* Strong SQL DBA knowledge with good grasp of SQL Joins and Advanced querying skills
* Should be able to create efficient tables, views, stored procedures and functions
