title: Maintenance Technician Sterilization
description:
Overzicht:  


Functieomschrijving:

Are you a Technician with experience in working in an environment where safety, quality, and customer satisfaction are of high priority? Consider joining our team in the profession of Maintenance Technician - Sterilization. We are expanding our operations in Amersfoort and are there for building a new state of the art Sterilization Plant. In this position, you will be responsible for installing, maintaining, setting-up and repairing equipment used in the process of sterilization of our advanced medical devices.  

You will be part of our local Maintenance team and will be reporting to the Maintenance Team Leader Sterilization. In addition, you will work closely together with our Engineering, Production, Quality and Safety teams. **Key Responsibilities*** Install new and maintain existing equipment
* Use mathematical or research techniques to solve complex problems
* Assist with the commissioning and qualification of new equipment
* Perform preventative and corrective maintenance and complete all associated controlled documentation
* Monitor, maintain and adjust equipment according to validated data and instructions to ensure products meet our quality standards
* Ordering and maintaining appropriate stock of equipment spare parts and tools
* Keeping work area clean and organized according to 5S


Functie-eisen:
* MBO 3 in Mechatronics, Mechanical or VAPRO-B
* At least 3 years of experience as Maintenance Technician
* At least 2 years with Steam Boilers and Valves and Pneumatic systems and Pressure valves
* First responder (BHV) certificate and VCA Basic
* Experience with grinders, column drills, bandsaw, and other workshop equipment
* Working with visualization software SCADA as well as hazardous liquids or gasses
* Working with safety equipment like raspatory masks and protective suit
* Proficient level of English and Dutch, both spoken and written
* Willing to work in two shifts (6:00-15:00 and 15:00-0:00), make use of own transport


Wij Bieden:
* An international working environment, fueled by respect and a healthy work-life balance tailored to the business and team member’s needs
* 27 paid vacation days (based on fulltime contract) with option to purchase five additional days
* Permanent employment contract
* Commuting allowance of €0,23/km or an NS Business card subscription
* A wide variety of internal trainings and development possibilities and a tuition program for external trainings
* The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
* State-of-the-art facilities, including green areas, in-house restaurant and gym
* Additional benefits, such as:
	+ Attractive pension scheme (your contribution at 4%, ours at 12%)
	+ €50 net monthly health insurance contribution
	+ Two (paid) days per year dedicated to volunteering activities
	+ Several fun company events and meaningful initiatives organized throughout the year


At Applied Medical, we are committed to make a meaningful, positive difference, each and every day. Within our European headquarters in Amersfoort (NL), we develop, manufacture and support the implementation of our advanced medical devices across Europe and the MENA region. Applied’s team members enjoy working in an environmentally friendly and international environment, in which people of diverse backgrounds are valued, challenged, and acknowledged. We support our team members by giving them opportunities of ongoing learning and education, possibilities to take part in community volunteering activities and a variety of onsite exercise classes and health activities.  

If you are passionate about working in an organization that allows you to make decisions based upon what is right for the patient, customer, community and environment, Applied Medical is the place for you. **Interested?**
Would you like to be part of our expanding team? If the answer is yes, we'd love to get to know you and look forward to hearing from you!
For more information regarding our hiring process, click here. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us via recruitment-eu@appliedmedical.com or +31 (0)33 7548713.  

Not the right job for you? Take a look at our other vacancies and follow us on LinkedIn.

title: Senior Payment Performance Consultant
description:
**The Company**


PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.

  

We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.

  

We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.

  

Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.


Job Description Summary: What you need to know about the role: Part of the overall Enterprise Platform Growth team, the Enterprise Performance Consulting (EPC) team leverages their data analysis, creative problem-solving, and passion for helping merchants to advise on and resolve complex performance issues. Their efforts are pivotal in driving the adoption of PayPal’s products and services. This global role requires engaging with merchants across all verticals PayPal serves, with a particular focus on providing a deeper level of expertise on European market needs. Meet our team: The Enterprise Performance Consulting (EPC) team is a global collective of data-driven consultants dedicated to working directly with PayPal’s top enterprise merchants on critical opportunities and issues. This role is based in Europe, where the team will utilize their extensive knowledge and skills to support and enhance the performance of merchants within this market.


Job Description:


**Your way to impact:**


The successful candidate will be an energetic and deep-thinking analyst who enjoys driving insights, developing frameworks to enhance merchant performance, and has a proven track record of distilling complex topics into impactful narratives. In this client-facing role, the candidate will collaborate with Sales, Product, and Engineering teams to secure key deals, provide continuous and proactive support to key merchants and our overall portfolio, and ensure customer-centric development within our product organization by representing the voice of the merchant.

**Your day-to-day:**

*In your day-to-day role, you will:*

* Act as a thought leader and trusted advisor to PayPal's top enterprise merchants by illustrating deep expertise in the many factors affecting conversion rates, auth rates, fraud/risk, and cost-of-payments
* Utilize data-driven insights and research to diagnose, advise on, and resolve top merchant performance concerns across the entire suite of PayPal enterprise products
* Drive adoption and retention of PayPal's products and services through data-driven storytelling, ROI analysis, and modelling
* Frequently pull together and manage partners, both internal and external to drive client outcomes. This includes but is not limited to: Product, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Issuing Banks, and Networks
* Drive customer-backed decisions by acting as the top of the funnel to our product and engineering organizations to relay merchant feedback and influence prioritization
* Illustrate a deep understanding of the payments ecosystem and the e-commerce landscape. Stay up-to-date on the latest payment trends, including regulatory changes (e.g., PSD3) and network mandates and their impact on our customers' business models
* Generate, leverage and scale insights from engagements to empower the broader PayPal organization, proactively source new business opportunities, and maintain PayPal's position as a thought leader

**What do you need to bring:**

* World-class strategic and analytical thinking with an excellent ability to put complex ideas into clear frameworks
* Strong track record in developing strategic insights and driving outcomes from quantitative and qualitative data
* Superior communication (verbal, prose, PowerPoint) skills; concise, clear and convincing with external client experience
* Extremely fluent in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Python) with sharp analytical skills-ability to dig into large data sets to distil actionable insights
* Familiarity with developer toolkits and integration components such as SDKs, APIs, etc.
* Appetite to learn and comfortable with uncertainty
* At least 5 years of experience in the payments industry, ideally in checkout, issuing, or card processing; Strong familiarity with the European markets' payment needs, including authentication, PSD3, 3DS / SCA, etc.
* Strong collaborator, with experience working across teams to drive results. Experience working with product and engineering is a plus
* Bring a constant sense of optimism and curiosity.
* Bachelors Degree required, MBA or quantitative degree preferred, but not mandatory

For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.

 **Our Benefits:**


At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.


We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com  



  

**Who We Are:**


To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx  



  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**


PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.


**Belonging at PayPal:**


Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.

  

Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.

  

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
company_description: We believe now is the time to revolutionize commerce globally to make moving money, selling and shopping simple, personalized and secure.

title: Project Manager, Discovery Program Management
description:
At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
Role  

The Portfolio & Project Management team at Genmab is looking for a temporary Discovery Project Manager (PM) in the Discovery Program Management team (Discovery PM)! The initial focus of the Discovery PM will be to support the projects within the New Formats and Technologies (NF&T) program. The Discovery PM will create overviews of the required work packages, align timelines of the cross functional research activities, and connect these to the overall NFT program timelines. Furthermore, the Discovery PM will be a key contributor in optimization of cross functional processes and connecting the different expertise teams within Genmab.
The Discovery PM will also handle several research collaborations in the NFT program. Together with the other Discovery PMs, the Discovery PM will develop PM tools and ensure consistency to successfully support Genmab’s research activities. This is a non-laboratory, management position, requiring excellent interpersonal and writing skills, a high level of organization, diplomacy, focus, ability to work under tight deadlines, and strong affinity with biotech research and drug development.
Are you looking for a temporary non-lab-based role that will allow you to immerse yourself in the world of antibody science? This might be the perfect fit for someone who loves science, sees the bigger picture, connects with people, and can quickly adapt to various projects.  

Responsibilities  

The Discovery PM works in partnership with the NFT program manager, the NFT program lead, Scientists, Department heads, Experts, Operational Resource Managers and other Discovery and Research departments to achieve the following:* Organize, structure and connect research activities in the New Formats & Technologies program centering around discovery and development of new formats & technologies:
* Organize and prepare cross functional team meetings to share and discuss data packages and facilitate decision making.
* Make inventory of required work packages, build the work plan and monitor progress, identify opportunities and escalate in a timely manner when objectives may not be met.
* Ensure close collaboration with the responsible scientist/experts to optimally execute the research activities.
* Communicate status and progress with relevant stakeholders (both internal and external).
* Support research teams for optimal collaboration by providing project management templates and tools (e.g. coordinate the set-up and use of MS Teams sites, coordinate set-up of research agreements and amendments, reporting templates).
* Ensure prioritization and timeline alignment between the various functions involved.
* Manage the project information, budgets, contracts, documentation, and team communications.
* Provide overviews of deliverables and budget estimates to the NFT Research Program Manager. Work with operational resource management to secure the required resources and budgets.
* Connect key stakeholders and optimize processes to improve effectiveness and satisfaction to achieve its goals through the networks of people/functions represented on the teams. This includes supporting departments, e.g. Administration, Contract Management, Finance, IP, Legal, Business Development.
* For external research collaborations, coordinate joint research activities and organize and prepare joint progress meetings. Other duties involve guiding scientific project meetings, managing logistics, timelines, and budgets.
* Within the Portfolio & Project Management department, actively contribute to set-up new research program management tools and capabilities.

  

Requirements  

* A minimum of a Master’s degree in life sciences is required;
* PhD in Life Sciences preferred;
* A minimum of +5 years of experience in biotech/pharmaceutical R&D or life sciences organization;
* Affinity with project management skills, including maintenance of schedules, development and management of project budget, change control, cross-team leadership, risk mitigation;
* Excellent internal/external communication and stakeholder management skills;
* A natural leader who is flexible, agile and results-oriented, with strong focus on providing structure and organizing while keeping the flexibility of a research organization;
* "Can do attitude" and have the necessary resilience and self-motivation required to make a maximum impact;
* Be able to successfully manage a wide diversity of program activities simultaneously;
* Affinity with planning software and visualization software is preferred.


About You* You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
* You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
* You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
* You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
* You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
* You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
* You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so


Locations
Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether you’re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.
About Genmab
Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose guiding its unstoppable team to strive towards improving the lives of patients through innovative and differentiated antibody therapeutics. For more than 20 years, its passionate, innovative and collaborative team has invented next-generation antibody technology platforms and leveraged translational research and data sciences, which has resulted in a proprietary pipeline including bispecific T-cell engagers, next-generation immune checkpoint modulators, effector function enhanced antibodies and antibody-drug conjugates. To help develop and deliver novel antibody therapies to patients, Genmab has formed 20+ strategic partnerships with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies. By 2030, Genmab’s vision is to transform the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases with Knock-Your-Socks-Off (KYSO™) antibody medicines.
Established in 1999, Genmab is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark with locations in Utrecht, the Netherlands, Princeton, New Jersey, U.S. and Tokyo, Japan.  

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.
Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy.
Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands, Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in NL is initially to offer a fixed-term employment contract for a year, if the employee performs well and if the business conditions do not change, renewal for an indefinite term may be considered after the fixed-term employment contract.
company_description: Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose of improving the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases.
ceo_name: Jan G. J. van de Winkel, Ph.D.,

title: HR Reporting & Analytics Expert
description:
38 hours, fulltime


You get further with data. Data provides knowledge and knowledge provides development. As an HR Reporting and Analytics Expert you provide this data. Solicited and unsolicited, you provide insights into where bottlenecks can be found and make sure management can take Actions!**This is your daily Actions**
------------------------------

  

  

Data can be overwhelming, but interpreting it is crucial. As an expert in Excel Power Query, you offer valuable insights by combining multiple data sources. Reporting to the Team Lead of HR Reporting and Analytics, you handle assignments from the business and initiate projects based on your functional HR insight. You are pivotal in managing HR data requests, using your analytical skills to anticipate problems and discuss solutions with your team. You collaborate with line managers across all our operating countries and are responsible for maintaining the HR master dataset in all HR applications. Your role includes defining data and reporting standards, developing reports, and resolving data issues.


And further:

* You provide structural analyses and reports on HR management information, personnel data and trend analyses.
* You identify your improvements regarding HR reporting from the HR Project Processes and Systems department and the HR organization. Also take care of the implementation.
* You support the management with valuable insights.
* You train your users to use new reports and dashboards.
**This is you**
---------------

  

  

Thanks to your experience in the data environment, you know what to look for. You are pragmatic with data and can prioritize well when pressure is increased and demand is high.  

You have excellent organizational skills and always maintain a clear overview. You like to collaborate with your colleagues, but you are also not afraid to do your work independently. In addition, you have a critical view when it comes to data manipulation and you give solicited and unsolicited advice about further optimizing and automating our reports


And further you have:

* Bachelor or Master in Business, HR, Data Analytics or a related field
* >5 years work experience preferably in an international environment
* Strong analytical skills and excellent Excel knowledge, including experience with Power Query.
* Experience in HR Data analysis, reporting and visualization
* You have gained experience in HR Cloud solutions such as SuccesFactors and SAP Analytics Clouds
* You have a strong command of the English language
* You are a team player and communicate well with colleagues in order to deliver qualitative insights
**What we offer**
-----------------

  

  

Surprisingly more! From our bustling home base in the Netherlands, you’ll have an impact on the whole of Europe. The counter now stands at more than 2,000 stores in 10 countries and millions of smiles from our customers. And we have big growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different job, an interesting innovation project, new skills: as a professional you can develop without limits. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect.


Did you know that you can also count on us for:

* Flexible working hours; decide for yourself which working hours suit you best
* The ability to work from home or the office
* A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
* 24 days of holiday and the option to buy 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week)
* 15% staff discount on your purchases at Action
* Travel allowance
* A company laptop
* Extensive education and training at our own Action Academy
* A good pension scheme, collective health insurance and travel expenses allowance (Zwaagdijk-Oost is traffic jam-free and only 30 minutes by car from Amsterdam)
**How we contribute to society**
--------------------------------

  

  

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you join us. For example, we are working hard behind the scenes to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,000 children worldwide who are growing up in an SOS Children’s Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 124 nationalities? That we already source 70% of our wood products and 86% of our cotton sustainably? And that only energy-efficient LED lighting is used in more than half of our stores? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.**Interested?**
---------------

  

  

We are proud to be an inclusive employer, and we warmly invite anyone who recognises themselves in the vacancy to apply. So take action and respond to this vacancy now!


What happens next:

* Response to your application within 14 days (and usually earlier)
* First meeting with the manager
* Second interview with your recruiter, among others
* Welcome to Action…


Throughout the process, your recruiter is your permanent point of contact and is available to answer any questions you may have.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Who are we looking for?**



BlockTech is a high-paced algorithmic trading firm facilitating global decentralized trading in cryptocurrency derivatives while expanding to regulated markets.



We are growing like never before and we are looking for a Data Engineer who wants to join us in this exciting scale-up phase!

 **What will you do?**



You ensure the reliability and the scalability of our data which will enable us to obtain top-notch performance and stay ahead of the game. This means that you will carry a high level of responsibility since you will have the ability to steer the direction of the company with your work.

  

You will have the opportunity to work on the whole cycle from producing and collecting, to storing and analyzing data and your main responsibilities consist of:

* Deployment, maintenance and configuration of our database systems. Making sure it performs, has a consistent design and can be used by the whole company.
* Coordination of structural improvements to our data collection. The data that is collected arrives timely and is 100% dependable. If there is an issue, the team should be alerted and follow up by solving the underlying issue.
* Monitoring and alerting on top of the database systems on a hardware level together with the infrastructure team as well as on a business level.
* Optimising and refactoring the current Databases and data pipelines.

 **What is in it for you?**


* The chance of a permanent, full-time position in a relaxed and trendy office located in Amsterdam
* A competitive base salary combined with an attractive bonus plan based on your performance as well as the company’s results
* Additionally, outstanding performance is rewarded with the opportunity to buy into the trading fund
* An extensive in-house training program
* A highly collaborative and experienced Scrum/Agile team
* The opportunity to use state-of-the-art technology
* A pension plan, a laptop and reimbursement of your internet costs at home
* The opportunity to do all kinds of sports during working hours like kickboxing classes, CrossFit, fitness and soccer
* Delicious catered lunches at the office, Friday drinks, game nights, sports competitions, gym membership and frequent company trips and events!
* Professional working experience as a Data Engineer in environments with large-scale operations working with high data volumes
* Fluency in Python and PostgreSQL
* Experience with Git and visualization tools like Grafana and Jupyter.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A critical mind who follows things until completion
* A high level of responsibility and ownership
* The ability to confidently coordinate and delegate tasks to other teams if required

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Returnista is one of Europe’s fastest growing startups.**
===========================================================



This is a pivotal role at Returnista that will shape our future success.

  

As we manage the returns process for our customers, we collect vast amounts of data. This data presents many opportunities to significantly reduce returns and increase sustainability within Ecommerce. In this role, you will be a key member of our team, responsible for building and supporting the data infrastructure that delivers critical insights and data-driven capabilities to our customers through our SaaS platform.

  



You will:

  

* Be passionate about using data to innovate and improve our service.
* Build and maintain ETL pipelines in AWS to provide data driven insights, both internally and to our customers.
* Build and maintain data services to provide data-driven product capabilities.
* Create and maintain data visualizations using AWS QuickSight or similar tools.
* Demonstrate proficiency in data privacy and security, with a strong awareness of best practices.

 **Skills and Experience:**


* Proven experience with Python, SQL, and PostgreSQL.
* Expertise in AWS services, particularly with ETL pipelines, RDS, and data visualization tools like QuickSight.
* Experience in designing and delivering data solutions.
* Familiarity with best compliance and security practices.
* Experience in implementing pre-existing machine learning algorithms using organizational data

 **I****f the following statements appeal to you, maybe we're a match…**


**What we do:**


* We work with CI/CD and other XP practices.
* We focus on the problem today, not tomorrow.
* We take pride in delivering quality.
* We work in small, frequent steps, continually getting feedback.
* We don’t constrain ourselves by convention.


**What we don't do:**


* We don’t use Jira.
* We don’t do scrum, sprints or estimate story points.
* We don’t build features – we deliver capabilities.
* We don’t do Gitflow – we do Trunk-based-development and CI/CD.


### **Our values and culture**

  


At Returnista, our working culture is guided by four core values:

 ***We’re on this journey together:*** Working at a successful startup isn’t the same every day, as we constantly grow and innovate, we face new challenges. It’s important that we embrace this journey but also positively support each other. In practice, this can range from pair programming to travelling and celebrating together.

 ***We do it right:*** When you’re moving fast it can be tempting to constantly cut corners to things done. But this results in a product that is a struggle to work with and has unhappy users. We make that extra effort to be proud of what we’re building; understand the problem we’re solving, write one more test or tackle technical debt.

 ***We are empowered to act, challenge and lead:*** To work effectively as a team everyone must have a voice and feel they can stand up and be counted. As a software engineer at Returnista we want you to feel empowered. That could mean proposing new ideas, fixing things without seeking permission or challenging the CEO.

 ***We are intrepid:*** We want our engineers to show initiative and to innovate. Intrepid Friday’s give us the opportunity to work on things that might not ostensibly be the highest priority, but can make a big difference to our product or how we work.

### **What we offer**


* Join a fast growing scale-up company
* Work in a positive, supportive and non-toxic environment
* Hybrid working opportunities
* Macbook Pro
* €2k annual training budget
* Annual travel budget to spend time with colleagues in other locations
* A degree or equivalent work experience


* Expertise in our core technology stack
* A continual learner and stay up to date with new technology, techniques and ideas.
* Understand the value of creativity and communication in software delivery
* Fluent in English, both verbal and written.

title: PhD in Innovative pathways for water pollution in the Mediterranean Agro-Hydro-System
Production Tech & Process Spec I (9196)
description:
Job description


**Orion Group Life Sciences are looking for a Production Tech & Process Spec I (Validation Expert) for our Pharmaceutical client based in the Haarlem Area. Initial 6-month contract.**

**What will you do**  

A highly skilled and experienced Senior Validation Consultant with expertise in validation/re-qualifications of Equipment/System including Project work/Changes/CAPAs. In addition, knowledge of steam sterilizers/autoclaves, lyophilizers, depyrogenation tunnels, smoke studies/air flow visualization studies & validation related to within the pharmaceutical industry. You will play a critical role in ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards while optimizing operational efficiency and product quality.

**Main Responsibilities of the role**

* Lead and participate in equipment qualification activities, including Installation Qualification (IQ), Operational Qualification (OQ), and Performance Qualification (PQ).
* Support execution of validation protocols/plans for Validations/Re-qualifications of steam sterilizers/autoclaves, lyophilizers, depyrogenation tunnels, smoke studies/air flow visualization studies.
* In case of deviations, Document, notify & co-ordinate for corrective action, and close out.
* Provide technical expertise and guidance on validation-related issues to project teams and stakeholders.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure validation activities align with production schedules, project timelines and quality expectations.
* Conduct risk assessments and impact analyses related to validation activities and propose appropriate mitigation strategies.
* Draft, review and assess validation data, deviations, and change controls to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and the internal quality standards of our client.
* Ensure adherence to Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) and Good Documentation Practice (GDP) during validation activities.

**Desired Experience and Background of the successful candidate**

* Bachelor's or higher degree in a relevant scientific or engineering discipline.
* Minimum 2 years of experience in validation/CQV within the pharmaceutical industry.
* Knowledge of experience in GMP including V-Model & SDLC methodologies.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, organizational and project management skills.
* Team player with attention to detail and strong can-do mentality.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams.


If you would like to have a confidential conversation regarding this opportunity please reach out to Tim Browaeys, tim.browaeys@orioneng.com or contact Tim on 0044 7593448607


#opportunity #multinational #pharmaceutical #production #tech #process #spec #validation #expert #GMP #GDP #IQ #OQ #PQ




Our role in supporting ***diversity*** and ***inclusion***  

As an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. In our inclusive workplace, regardless of your employment status as staff or contract, everyone is assured the right of equitable, fair and respectful treatment.

title: Sr Process Improvement Engineer
description:
If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us as:

**Process Improvement Engineer**


At Amgen Breda medicines are labeled, assembled, stored, and eventually shipped to various countries worldwide. Every day more than 1000 people from 38 different nationalities are working on supply chain processes, manufacturing, marketing, and sales of our medicines and clinical research into new medicines.

**LIVE**

**What you will do**


The Operations Improvement Team (OIT) is responsible for the overall process performance of our labeling & packaging lines in Breda. The team monitors the line output and investigates deviating events or trends.


As Sr Process Improvement Engineer you will identify improvement opportunities within our shopfloor and supporting processes. In collaboration with other departments, you will lead or contribute to business cases for process optimization and new production lines. Furthermore, you will investigate different scenarios for new product introductions, increasing production volumes, and other mid-long-term strategic initiatives.


With your strong analytical skills, you will optimize data collection, monitoring, analysis, and visualization to assess current performance and identify trends, and improvement actions. With your broad technical and process knowledge you will support key decision making for our long-term initiatives and goals to ensure the supply of our medicines to our patients!


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role, you will:

* Apply robust analytical skills to evaluate and interpret data using multiple sources of information (qualitative, quantitative, and trend data).
* Monitor process performance and identify trends and improvement opportunities.
* Keep processes in line with ever-changing requirements (quality, safety, technical, or technology) by assessing impact and proposing solutions.
* Interpret stakeholders need to identify improvement opportunities and use LEAN / Six Sigma to drive them.
* Lead implementation of selected improvement projects and initiatives.
* Utilize advanced data analysis combined with subject matter expertise in operations to assist and guide decision-making by senior management on longer-term initiatives and projects (e.g. new capabilities or capacity improvements).
* Provide training and guidance to change leaders on the shop floor and supporting departments.

**WIN**

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The industrial engineer we seek is an analytical person with these qualifications:

* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering or equivalent due to experience.
* Proven experience in the field of Industrial Engineering, Performance Improvement and/or Operational Excellence in an Operations / Manufacturing environment.
* Ability to work in a highly regulated business environment (GMP, GDP).
* Experience in optimizing internal value streams and managing projects.
* Demonstrated analytical skills and application of problem-solving (such as Six Sigma or Root Cause Analyses).
* Digital savvy and expert skills in using multiple analytical tools.
* Fluency in English both in oral and written communication.

**THRIVE**

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Therefore, Amgen is regularly recognized as a Great Place To Work ©.

* Vast opportunities to learn and move up and across our global organization.
* Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act.
* A generous total rewards plan is comprised of a competitive salary, bonus structure, a fixed 13th month, holiday allowance, and collective health insurance.
* Focus on vitality with an on-site gym, a vitality program, and a restaurant with healthy food.
* Flexible work arrangement with 3 - 4 days a week in the office and days from home.
company_description: Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics.

title: Business Analyst
description:
The Business Analyst is part of the Strategy & Transformation Office (STO), reporting into the Transformation Lead for the Business Intelligence and Benchmarking program. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and data-driven solutions.
**Business Analyst**

**Company**

A.P. Moller-Maersk (Maersk) is a worldwide transport and logistics company with offices in around 130 countries and with global headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark. Maersk is listed on the Copenhagen Stock Exchange. Maersk employs roughly 95,000 people and generated total revenue of 51 billion USD in 2023. Maersk is currently undergoing a complex transformation from having been a relatively diversified conglomerate to becoming a focused transport and logistics company.


APM Terminals (APMT), a maritime terminal operator and core business unit of Maersk, operates one of the world’s most comprehensive port networks, which is uniquely positioned to help both shipping line- and landside customers grow their business and achieve better supply chain efficiency, flexibility and dependability to compete and win in world markets. The APMT team of 23,000 industry professionals across 42 countries and spanning five continents, is focused on providing customers with the most advanced terminal technology, equipment and operations in the industry across a network of +75 ports. In 2023, APM Terminals generated revenues 3.8 billion USD and carried out 40 million TEUs.


APMT is, like Maersk, undergoing an all-encompassing transformation from a multi-local, loosely coupled portfolio of individual terminals towards an integrated, best-in-class global terminal operator and stevedore. We casually refer to the journey as ‘ *from freestyle to franchise’* . The transformation involves developing and rolling out APMT’s *Way of Working* , built around a common operating system founded on Lean principles. It also entails a fundamental overhaul of our (digital) enterprise architecture to enable data-fueled business decisions, and cross-pollination of standard processes across our operations, including automation. Finally, the transformation aims to embed a culture of joint problem solving, (local) entrepreneurship and a collaborative mindset across our organization, including strong(er) linkages between our HQ- and frontline teams.


**Business Analyst in the Business Intelligence & Benchmarking program**

The Business Analyst is part of the Strategy & Transformation Office (STO), reporting into the Transformation Lead for the Business Intelligence and Benchmarking program. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and data-driven solutions. Your role is to be a partner to the business, in which you will collaborate with business stakeholders to understand what drives value and assess indicators and data models for this. You will need to create an understanding of operational or business processes, develop models to represent this, and analyse data to create actionable insights. You will also work together closely with our data delivery teams to co-create what our data products need to look like, translated from business and technical requirements you help create. Lastly, together with the team, you will need to work together to contribute to the broader roadmap of data-driven value identification across the business, contributing to the project plans and initiatives to achieve this.


This position requires a mix of strong analytical & logical thinking, business acumen, problem solving, data analysis skills and project management, as well as stakeholder management, soft skills and the ability to frame up, execute, and drive resolution to complex issues. This is a dynamic, fast paced role that involves simultaneously seeing the bigger picture along with the small pieces that are critical to success.


**We are looking for**

* A passion for working with business stakeholders in identifying value and improvement initiatives
* A strong analytical mind that can navigate complexity in operations and business, can distil priority areas, and can simplify this into a problem statement and (data-driven) solution plan
* Someone that utilizes data-savviness to think through use-cases and ensure that data solutions align with business and operational needs
* Someone with strong data analysis and modelling skills that can easily extract key insights and is able to spot key patterns in information. Proficiency in data analysis tools & techniques (Excel & SQL, data-querying or similar, advanced techniques are a plus)
* Someone that can present and visualize these insights in a logical and comprehensible way that helps drive actionable insights and supports business decisions. Proficiency in presentation, visualization and insights tools & techniques (Powerpoint & PowerBI or similar)
* Flexibility with the ability to manage multiple topics and projects simultaneously and take ownership and responsibility of projects, with the tenacity to see them through
* A collaborative team player that is hands-on with a can-do attitude and proactive
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written). Possess empathy, personal tact, and multi-cultural understanding
* Strong project management skills, with experience in creating and managing project plans
* Familiarity with agile way-of-working and defining technical and business requirements
* A minimum of 4+ years work experience in a similar capacity, experience in generating or working with data-driven insights, and working with business and operational processes definition and analysis
* Consulting experience is a plus
* Experience with the logistics, transportation, or mining industry is a plus – experience in working with large complex (blue chip) companies is a must
* English fluency written and spoken, and international work experience is beneficial
* Based in the Netherlands, but willingness to travel
* Master’s degree in e.g., Math, Physics, Engineering, Econometrics, Finance, Business Administration, or similar

*Research shows that while male candidates feel confident enough to apply when they meet about 60% of the requirements, female candidates only apply when they tick every box. So if this role has your name on it, but you’re not sure about the criteria, we still want to hear from you.*

Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.  



We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com .

title: Software engineer, Laser micromachining / CAM
description:
Lightmotif, Enschede
  
Job description
  
As a software engineer you are working on improving our machine control and CAM software. You are part of
  
a small product development team that’s responsible for the development of advanced laser micromachining
  
systems.
  
You will design, implement, and test new functionality for our systems. You will work on custom machining
  
systems, participate in collaborative research projects, and work with our laser process engineers and
  
industrial end-users on the development of new laser micromachining applications.
  
Lightmotif is a small company. That means your job will be diverse, as you will be working on multiple projects
  
at a time, with different technical challenges. It also means you have the opportunity to really make a
  
difference—you will have a significant impact on the direction of our software development.
  
Responsibilities • Design, implement, test, and maintain / improve software.
  
* Work in R&D projects on new system capabilities and develop new applications together with our


laser process engineers.
  
* Assist customers with custom applications, training, or troubleshooting.


Qualifications
  
Minimum qualifications
  
* BS degree in computer science, similar technical field of study or equivalent experience.
* Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages.
* Ability to speak and write Dutch as well as English fluently in a professional working environment.


Preferred qualifications
  
* Further education or experience in engineering, computer science, or other technical related field.
* Advanced level C, C++, or Python programming skills.
* Experience in one or more of the following fields: visualization / computer graphics, motion control /


robotics, web application development, CAD/CAM, industrial automation, data acquisition and
  
control, programmable logic controllers, networking, embedded systems.
  
* Experience with programming and/or system administration in a UNIX environment.
* Strong people and communication skills.


Company profile
  
Lightmotif is an innovative supplier of ultrashort pulse laser micromachining systems and processes. We
  
support customers from first idea to production in diverse markets like automotive, consumer products or
  
medical devices. We develop and sell high-end machines, support customers in process and application
  
development, and offer job-shop services for small scale production.
  
Contact
  
Martijn Sipkema
  
**Email:** martijn.sipkema@lightmotif.nl
  
**Tel:** 053-4500840
  
**Website:** www.lightmotif.nl
  
**To all recruitment agencies:** Lightmotif does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to us. Lightmotif is not
  
responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes

title: Technology Strategy & Advisory Manager - Products Industry
description:
**The Work**

  

Are you a visionary leader ready to transformative and innovate businesses in the Products sector? Do you possess a deep understanding of the dynamic challenges our Consumer Goods & Services, Retail, Travel and Industrial clients are facing who have the ambition to digitalize their businesses, become more Agile, reduce IT cost, simplify their IT-landscape and move to the Cloud adopting value added services/technologies? If you're passionate about leveraging data insights and cutting-edge technology solutions to drive sustainable growth in the industry, particularly within the ‘Products’ sector, we want to hear from you!


We are Technology Strategy & Advisory! Our vision is to become the leading trusted advisors in harnessing technology and innovations as a force to reinvent every business. As part of our growing Technology Strategy & Advisory team, we are looking for a Technology Strategy & Advisory Manager specializing in the Products domain.


As a Manager you will work in high performance teams to address priority C-suite issues with precision and speed, tailored to the specific needs of Consumer Goods & Services, Retail, Travel and Industrial companies. Together with your team of young and enthusiastic colleagues, your role will be to help clients drive profitable growth through digital transformation, succeed in the generative AI era and generate enduring, long-term sustainable value. In addition to leading strategic initiatives and fostering innovation, you will help the client identify and capitalize on opportunities for business growth within the products sector. You help them gain an understanding of their most crucial challenges, analyze, and communicate your recommendations, to contribute to the client’s success, as well as Accenture’s.

* **Team** you will serve as a trusted advisor to our clients: In Technology Strategy & Advisory, we articulate a compelling technology vision with industry expertise and context. You will work with C-level executives, digital marketers and/or IT managers. With your ~80 colleagues you are at the heart of the change, developing value case and operating model with disruptive technologies in short to medium engagements. As a TS&A manager you will be positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry. We devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. Our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.
* **Processes** you get energy from solving complex puzzles and working in teams: Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Applying data-driven methods to analyze our clients’ strategic challenges, solving complex problems and helping them realize their business strategy through the right use of new technologies. Beside the work for our clients you will also be contributing to our practice and help the team grow and develop by e.g. participating and organizing events, creating points-of-view, and sharing your knowledge.
* **Technology** convey a deep understanding of technology platforms and architecture: Convey deep understanding of technology platforms and architecture at intersection of client's industry to (re)define the client’s technology stack. Realize value, advise, and execute medium to longer term technology transformations such as multi-year Cloud journeys with a clear industry focus, leveraging cloud partners and platforms to drive innovation, flexibility and agility across enterprise and build new businesses.
* **Data** you will develop a data strategy, design innovations, and operating models: You will understand the importance of data for business decision making. Helping our clients to become truly data/insight driven by identifying a measurable business value from data & analytics, by designing and building the required capabilities and by driving embedding of data & analytics into their decisions, processes and day to day operations. You will learn teams how to do data-driven storytelling through quantitative analysis and data visualization.


With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs.

**Who we are**

  

In today’s world, business leaders want to rapidly and confidently reinvent to increase resilience, mitigate risk, and grow with sustainable value. That’s where Accenture Strategy & Consulting comes in. We bring together strategic visionaries, industry experts, practitioners from across every enterprise function, business intelligence professionals, change specialists, data and AI authorities, and many other specialized skills to co-create each client’s unique path to reinvention. You will be a trusted partner to business leaders, working with a diverse team of experts to deliver successful tech-enabled transformation and new kinds of value for your clients. Join our global network of people using the latest assets, platforms and partnerships to help bring ideas to life.


Strategy & Consulting is one of five services that make up one Accenture – the others are Operations, Technology, Song and Industry X.


#LI-EU


  

**Here's what you'll need**

  

\* Do you want to work with great people and be part of a diverse team? We encourage you to apply even if you do not meet 100% of the below requirements. We are looking forward to meeting you, so don't hesitate to give us a call and discuss this! \*

* A finished Masters degree
* Multiple years of external consulting experience
* Industry knowledge in the Consumer Goods & Services, Retail, Travel, or Industrial sector
* 6-8 years of experience in technology strategy and/or large scale digital and technology transformations
* Knowledge on latest technology advancements (in a certain technology area and/or industry) based on previous experience and interest in the latest innovations
* Consulting skills, e.g., solid financial and business acumen, structured and abstract thinking, analytical and creative problem solving, project management, prioritizing, communication, and stakeholder management
* Strong personality, presentation and communicative skills
* Fluent in English- spoken and written
* Proven affinity with Digital/IT and Technology (e.g., in your hobbies or work experience)

**Bonus Points If You Have**

* Fluency in Dutch
* Certifications e.g., Cloud, SAFe

**What's in it for you?**

* Accenture is a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Our people are Change Makers, and to support them as an employer, we make five promises:
* Develop yourself and embrace a sustainable growth mindset
* Work with flexibility, in a culture based on trust
* Live a human-led culture of Inclusion & Diversity by caring deeply for all our people.
* Lead and transform our clients with technology
* Connect with our global network of 700.000 colleagues.


These promises are reflected through our excellent employee benefits, including:

* Unlimited learning: access to thousands of free courses, classes and workshops.
* Flexible working hours (4x9) & work location, and FlexDay; a flexible day you can take off to celebrate what matters to you – from EidalFitr to a birthday.
* Paid leave: Parental leave, Paternity leave for all non-birthing parents, Bereavement leave, and Gender affirmation leave.
* Paid transport (budget for electric bicycle or car, NS-Business card)
* A laptop, iPhone, and home office setup allowance
* Pension scheme, Accenture shares, annual bonus, collective health insurance scheme.

**What we believe**


Accenture is an equal opportunity employer. Our leaders are committed to building a better, stronger and more equitable company for future generations to create positive, long-lasting change. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Our position as partner to many of the world’s leading businesses, organizations and governments affords us both an extraordinary opportunity and a tremendous responsibility to make a difference. Sustainability is one of our greatest responsibilities, which we embed it into everything we do and for everyone we work with. Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all. Please let us know if you require reasonable accommodation to enable your participation in the recruitment process by emailing dorine.hogendorp@accenture.com. We will be happy to assist you.

 **Please note that we need your resume, transcripts of records (secondary education, bachelors and masters) and cover letter in order to proceed. You can upload all documentation in the box where you can also upload your resume.**

title: Senior Data Analyst with Data Engineering Interest
description:
#### **About Us**



We are a dynamic scale-up with an increasing demand for data-driven insights to fuel our growth and innovation. We pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment where every team member has the opportunity to make a significant impact.

#### **Role Overview**



We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst with a passion for data engineering to join our team. In this role, you will work directly with various teams to gather requirements, create insightful charts and dashboards, and help implement cutting-edge AI models. You will also be responsible for setting up and maintaining our data stack, and analyzing trends to provide actionable insights. This position offers a high level of responsibility and freedom, reporting directly to our management team.  



  

  

#### **Key Responsibilities**


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and trends.
* Analyze dashboards and interpret trends, summarize your findings, and report them to senior management.
* Assist in the design and implementation of AI models to enhance our data capabilities.
* Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and accessibility across all reporting tools.
* Help ensure data quality and integrity in the application.
* Support data engineering tasks to streamline data pipelines and improve data infrastructure.
* Leverage AWS and/or GCP platforms for data processing and analytics.
* Utilize Amplitude for product analytics and user behavior insights (preferred).
* Coordinate various stakeholders for engineering support.

#### **Qualifications**


* Proven experience as a Senior Data Analyst or in a similar role (minimum of 3-5 years).
* Strong proficiency in data visualization tools and techniques.
* Proficient with using SQL to create complex queries.
* Solid understanding of data engineering principles and practices.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS and/or GCP.
* Familiarity with Looker, AWS QuickSight, AWS Athena
* Familiarity with Amplitude, Python & Redshift is a strong plus.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders and present findings.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* A proactive mindset with a willingness to take ownership of projects.

Experience working with start-up companies, preferred in e-commerce companies  
* 

  

#### **What We Offer**


* A vibrant and inclusive work environment with opportunities for growth and development.
* The freedom to innovate and make a real impact on the company’s success.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Flexible working hours and the option to work remotely part of the time.
* Access to the latest tools and technologies to support your work.

#### **How to Apply**



Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience and why they are a great fit for this role to kristina@yourtalent.agency


Join us and be a part of a team that values creativity, collaboration, and a drive for excellence in data analytics and engineering.

title: Director Data Product Ownership
description:
General Purpose:  


As a Director Data Product Ownership at adidas Digital you are responsible for the quality and strategic impact of a wide range of products within a product domain. Together with your product owners and agile teams, you work on continuously improving and evolving the product area, maximizing the value for the customer and the company.  


Partnering with IT and markets to define a robust product landscape, managing capability expansion increments and leading the teams towards definition of new functionalities & best practices are a few examples of the activities that will be expected from this role. Additionally, you will be the strategic interface to various global key stakeholders, including Global Markets, Brands and Global Digital IT for the product area, driving consumer engagement and satisfaction, as well as incremental revenues out of delivering digital experiences.  


Key Responsibilities - Scope: Accountable for a wide range of products (>1m € budget)  


Product Strategy & Delivery:  


* Be accountable for the success of the product area considering the value for the consumer and the company (ROI) using common ROI and TCO frameworks for value and cost management, and product-led success measurement framework for team health and product maturity
* Define the mid to long-term vision and roadmap of the product area considering the value for the consumer and the company as well as its role and impact on the adidas digital ecosystem
* Be accountable for product delivery in line with the roadmap and committed delivery dates
* Identify and solve dependencies within and beyond your product area to ensure efficient realization of product adoption and success

  


Delivery:  


* Represent the business for the product area, fostering strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure that their views and requirements are captured in the product backlogs
* Act as the ambassador for your product area, showcasing the key functionalities, managing product adoption and assuring operational excellence
* Manage relationships outside the product area efficiently to ensure that the product teams can work autonomously

  


Backlog Management:  


* Drive the evolution of the product area backlogs in collaboration with the product owners
* Influence roadmaps and backlogs from other product areas
* Ensure backlogs account for and integrate dependencies across functional areas like privacy, security, and governance
* Provide input into Global roadmap development to maintain an end-to-end corporate view

  


Product Discovery & Insights:  


* Be accountable for monitoring, optimization and enhancement of the configuration, features and functionalities related to the product area using data driven methods
* Ensure that objective data sources and feedback are used for the optimization of the product area
* Share product domain insights with colleagues across the company to bring partners on the innovation journey
* Write both long and short-term strategic market analysis, product analysis, playbooks, and performance reports to contextualize the product domain insights – including successes and failures

  


If required – Responsibilities:  


People Management:  


* Build the appropriate structure to be able to manage the respective organization effectively, identify and develop the future talents and create realistic succession scenarios for key positions
* Ensure appropriate leadership skills are present at every level by creating a motivational and supportive work environment in which employees are coached, trained and provided with career opportunities through development
* Continuously monitor and evaluate team workload and organizational efficiency with the support of data and team feedback and make appropriate changes in order to meet business needs
* Provide team members/direct reports with clear direction and targets that are aligned with business needs and objectives

  


Key Relationships:  


* Global Digital Teams
* COE and Market teams
* Global IT and Global Operations
* Global Brand organizations
* Group functions
* External vendors
* External vendors

  


Requirements, Education & Experience:  


* Master’s degree in Information Science, Statistics, IT, or Business Administration, or equivalent combination of education an experience
* Strong track record leading Digital product development in a multi-national business environment; experience in Digital and eCommerce strongly preferred
* Experience in working with stakeholders and experts at various organizational levels
* Experience in creating strong internal product narratives that include a business case to support investment
* Experience as a Product Owner in multiple product areas or domains
* 3+ years of experience in leading a team

  


Soft-Skills:  


* Distinctive strategic mindset and ability to prioritize and delegate high numbers of tasks with varying workload and importance
* Ability to handle ambiguity and untangle complex situations into actionable activities
* High resilience and solution-oriented attitude
* Very good leadership skills
* Engaging meeting and work session facilitation skills

  


Hard-Skills:  


* Good Analytical and Data Visualization Skills
* Ability to adapt to new technologies and tools, processes, and ambiguity
* Good understanding of value-measurement frameworks
* Good project planning and organizational skills
* In-depth knowledge of the product domain and its ecosystem
* In-depth knowledge of Agile working methods e.g. Scrum/Kanban
* Comfortable working with enterprise-level platforms and technologies
* In-depth understanding of technology and Digital capabilities
* Fluent in English both verbally and written


AT ADIDAS WE HAVE A WINNING CULTURE. BUT TO WIN, PHYSICAL POWER IS NOT ENOUGH. JUST LIKE ATHLETES OUR EMPLOYEES NEED MENTAL STRENGTH IN THEIR GAME. WE FOSTER THE ATHLETE’S MINDSET THROUGH A SET OF BEHAVIORS THAT WE WANT TO ENABLE AND DEVELOP IN OUR PEOPLE AND THAT ARE AT THE CORE OF OUR UNIQUE COMPANY CULTURE: THIS IS HOW WE WIN WHILE PLAYING FAIR.




COURAGE: Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need..


OWNERSHIP: Pick up the ball. Be proactive, take responsibility and follow-through.


INNOVATION: Elevate to win. Be curious, test and learn new and better ways of doing things.


TEAMPLAY: Win together. Work collaboratively and cultivate a shared mindset.


INTEGRITY: Play by the rules. Hold yourself and others accountable to our company’s standards.


RESPECT: Value all players. Display empathy, be inclusive and show dignity to all.


**ADIDAS CELEBRATES DIVERSITY, SUPPORTS INCLUSIVENESS AND ENCOURAGES INDIVIDUAL EXPRESSION IN OUR WORKPLACE. WE DO NOT TOLERATE THE HARASSMENT OR DISCRIMINATION TOWARD ANY OF OUR APPLICANTS OR EMPLOYEES. WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.**

title: BI Team Lead
description:
Do you thrive in a fast-paced, data-driven environment? Are you passionate about using your technical skills to drive business insights and solutions? If so, we want to hear from you!


Hunkemoller, a leading international lingerie retailer, is seeking a talented and motivated Lead BI Developer to join our dynamic team. This role will play a key role in delivering insightful data solutions and supporting our continued growth.

**What you'll do:**

* Lead and mentor a team of BI developers: Provide guidance and support to junior team members, fostering their development and skills.
* Develop and maintain complex BI solutions: Design, implement, and optimize data models, reports, dashboards, and visualizations using industry standard BI tools.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders: Understand their data needs, translate them into actionable insights, and communicate complex technical concepts clearly.
* Prioritize and manage projects: Work closely with the BI Manager to define project scope, track progress, and deliver high-quality results within deadlines.
* Contribute to data architecture and process improvements: Proactively identify opportunities to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of our BI infrastructure and workflows.

**Who you are:**

* Experience with BI tools and technologies: Expert level knowledge of at least one major BI platform (e.g., Looker, Tableau, SAC) and experience with data warehousing concepts (BigQuery a plus).
* A strong communicator: Able to effectively translate complex data insights into clear and compelling presentations for stakeholders across various levels.
* A collaborative team player: Enthusiastic about coaching and supporting junior team members to reach their full potential.
* Detail-oriented and organized: Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.
* A strategic thinker: Eager to learn and contribute to the overall data strategy of the organization.


This is a fantastic opportunity for a talented BI developer looking to take on a leadership role and make a real impact at a global brand. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as the chance to work with a diverse and passionate team.


Hunkemöller is a place for people who have a passion for creating great products and world class service for our customers and colleagues; a place for people to grow, to be future stars, and who want the opportunity to develop both themselves and their teams.


If you want to join our rapidly growing Hunkemöller headquarters team? Please click on 'apply now' to send your resume/CV (in English). Please note that, as we’re an internationally successful company, the whole application process will be in English.

**Gordon Smith**  

**Director of IT**  


"Our IT developments are designed to drive the business ambition of moving from digital maturity to leadership. Starting with the customer and users we work backwards to deliver a joined up solution across our business."  

Hunkemöller's vision is to become a global and social brand and we are very successful in combining the traditional retail (bricks) channel with the e-commerce channel (clicks). We are truly focused on transitioning towards an Omni channel retailer combined with a social brand. Our IT team is constantly designing, developing, executing and maintaining a robust and innovative IT strategy that can keep up with the current and future developments in the IT landscape and the customer service expectations of our sheroes. **Get familiar with our application process:**  

  

* **10 seconds Application**
Send your application! Our tip: no motivation letter required; we have something much better - see step 2!
* **Video Interview on-demand**
We hire for attitude, hence why we're looking forward getting to know you even better!
* **Live interview(s)**
Get invited to chat with us...
* **Offer**
Land your dream job with us!
* **Hired**
Welcome to Hunkemöller - You'll sign your digital contract and are ready to start.
* **Onboarding & Development Journey**
Start your career - kick off with our Onboarding & grow your talents.
**Your benefits if you join a TOP EMPLOYER:**  

  

* **Internal Learning Platform**
* **Flexible Working Hours**
* **Dynamic and Fast-Paced Environment**
* **Restaurant on site with freshly-made food**
* **Lifestyle Workshops**
* **Collective Company Insurance Discount**
* **Support in Travel Expenses**
* **Community Events**
* **Pension Support**
* **Staff Discount**
* **Performance Reviews**
* **Hybrid Working Module & Home Office Allowance**
**Proudly presenting our 2021 Fashion Show:**
